poem:
**The Clown Prince of Scrubby Creek**

Toothy grin beneath a wide-brimmed hat,  
songs spun from laughter, gum trees, night,  
Chad's voice a warp in time's cool fabric,  
his creek still echoes in the charted light.  
Notes plucked from red dust scatter sky,  
as hum and twang in memory's flight.  
Farewell, Sheik, the Outback's own delight.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Chad Morgan, Australian country music star, dies aged 91 Australian country music singer Chad Morgan, known as the “Sheik of Scrubby Creek” after one of his most famous songs, has died aged 91. Known for his humorous country songs and toothy smile – which inspired Barry Humphries’ design for his character Sir Les Patterson – Morgan’s music career spanned more than 70 years, releasing his first album in 1952. He was dubbed the “clown prince". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
